lessons.lessonContent: A for loop is used for iterating over a sequence. This is used more for iterator method. This is also found in the other object-oriented programming languages. You can also loop through strings. The way to terminate a loop is going to be called a break statement. This break statement will stop the loop before it loops through all of the items.

questions.questionTitle: How do you print a string

lessons.lessonContent: A string is a data structure that represents a sequence of characters. The way to initialize a string in python is by labeling it "String= 'Welcome, my name is John' " Then you need to print the string by saying "print(String)" This will now print the string out to the user.

answerChoices: Can be a negative or positve number, without decimals, unlimited length

lessons.lessonContent: Ints are known as integers. They are going to be whole numbers, positive or negative, without decimals, and they are unlimited lengths. the way to do an int is by saying "x = 1" then when you print out this int you can say "print(type(x))"

questions.questionTitle: What is the difference between a float and an int

lessons.lessonContent: A floating point number is a number that is positive or negative that contains one or more decimals. The difference between an int and a float is the ability to contain decimals. For example: "x = 1.10" and then to print out this float you need to say "print(type(x))"

A for loop is used for iterating over a sequence. This is used more for iterator method. This is also found in the other object-oriented programming languages. You can also loop through strings. The way to terminate a loop is going to be called a break statement. This break statement will stop the loop before it loops through all of the items.

questions.questionTitle: How do you print a string

lessons.lessonContent: A string is a data structure that represents a sequence of characters. The way to initialize a string in python is by labeling it "String= 'Welcome, my name is John' " Then you need to print the string by saying "print(String)" This will now print the string out to the user.

answerChoices: Can be a negative or positve number, without decimals, unlimited length

lessons.lessonContent: Ints are known as integers. They are going to be whole numbers, positive or negative, without decimals, and they are unlimited lengths. the way to do an int is by saying "x = 1" then when you print out this int you can say "print(type(x))"

questions.questionTitle: What is the difference between a float and an int

lessons.lessonContent: A floating point number is a number that is positive or negative that contains one or more decimals. The difference between an int and a float is the ability to contain decimals. For example: "x = 1.10" and then to print out this float you need to say "print(type(x))"

answerChoices: You can convert between float and int
You can print the values by print(a) or print(b)
questions.questionTitle: Please identify the false statement below

lessons.lessonContent: Type conversion is going to allow you to convert one type to another type. We can use int() and float() as methods. Here is an example : " x = 1" so to convert the int to a float we will do " a = float(x)" and then to print this float we just need to do "print(a)" To convert from a float to an int we need to initialize the float first! "y = 2.8" Then we need to convert by "b = int(y)" now we need to print it by "print(b)"
lessons.lessonName: Type conversion between int and float
